pdhp50:1: Restraint is good everywhere, restraint is everywhere good,
pdhp50:2: a monastic who is restrained everywhere is liberated from all suffering.
pdhp51:1: Restraint of body is good, restraint of speech is good,
pdhp51:2: restraint of mind is also good, restraint is everywhere good,
pdhp51:3: a monastic who is restrained everywhere is liberated from all suffering.
pdhp52:1: One who controls his hands, controls his feet, controls his speech, controls the mind faculty,
pdhp52:2: with inner delight and composure, solitary, content: that one is called a monastic.
pdhp53:1: Calm in body and calm in mind, having calmness and composure,
pdhp53:2: having thrown off worldly gain the monastic is called one at peace.
pdhp54:1: That monastic who restrains the mouth, who speaks well, and who is modest,
pdhp54:2: who teaches the meaning of the Dhamma, his speech is sweet.
pdhp55:1: One should not despise one’s own gains, one should not live envious of others,
pdhp55:2: the monastic who is envious of others does not attain concentration.
pdhp56:1: Even if a monastic gains little he should not despise his gains,
pdhp56:2: even the very gods praise the one of pure life who is diligent.
pdhp57:1: Please bail out this boat, monastic, when bailed out it will go lightly,
pdhp57:2: cutting off passion and hatred, from here one will go to Nibbāna.
pdhp58:1: With uplifted mind, happy, having overcome what is dear and not dear,
pdhp58:2: then with lots of happiness, the monastic should wander mindfully.
pdhp59:1: That monastic who dwells in loving-kindness, with faith in Buddha’s dispensation,
pdhp59:2: has penetrated the state of peace, the joy in stilling of all conditions,
pdhp59:3: here and now there is Nibbāna, the unsurpassed release from all bonds.
pdhp60:1: For the one who has entered an empty place, a monastic with a peaceful mind,
pdhp60:2: there is superhuman delight from insight into true Dhamma.
pdhp61:1: Just as one with right mindfulness regarding the rise and fall of the components of mind and body
pdhp61:2: gains happiness in mind, this is the deathless state for the one who knows.
pdhp62:1: There is no concentration for one without wisdom, there is no wisdom for one without concentration,
pdhp62:2: that one in whom there is concentration and wisdom is indeed close to Nibbāna.
pdhp63:1: This is the very beginning for the wise monastic here:
pdhp63:2: contentment, guarding the senses, and restraint in the regulations.
pdhp64:1: One should resort to spiritual friends, ones of pure life, ones who are diligent,
pdhp64:2: one should be one of friendly disposition, one who will be skilful in conduct,
pdhp64:3: rejoicing frequently because of that, the monastic should wander mindfully.
